info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued August 17 at 6:01AM CDT by NWS QuadCities
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 630 AM CDT FOR MERCER AND SOUTHWESTERN HENRY COUNTIES... At 601 AM CDT, a severe thunderstorm was located over Joy, or near Aledo, moving east at 50 mph. HAZARD...Quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Damage to vehicles is expected. This severe storm will be near... Seaton around 605 AM CDT. Other locations in the path of this severe thunderstorm include Aledo, Mercer County Fairgrounds, Sunbeam, Aledo Mercer County Airport, Gingle Corners, Burgess, Matherville, Shale City, Gilchrist, Wanlock, Old Gilchrist, Viola, Boden, Alexis, New Windsor, North Henderson, New Windsor, Cable, Griffin, Alpha, Ophiem and Woodhull. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...<50 MPH
info.instruction: To report severe weather contact your nearest law enforcement agency. They will send your report to the National Weather Service office in the Quad Cities.
